alert.note: Alert for Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 27 at 10:58AM EDT until March 28 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR WEST CENTRAL SPALDING COUNTY... The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... A Dam Break on the Heads Creek below Head`s Creek Reservoir in... West Central Spalding County in west central Georgia... * Until 800 AM EDT Tuesday. * At 1058 AM EDT, County Emergency Management has reported the imminent failure of Head`s Creek Reservoir dam. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for West Central Spalding County. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding from the imminent failure of Head`s Creek Reservoir dam. SOURCE...Emergency Manager. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! IMMEDIATE EVACUATION for areas downstream from the Head`s Creek Reservoir along the Heads Creek, including West McIntosh Road, Vaughan Road, West Ellis Road, Moon Road, and may impact Highway 16 after the creek drains into the Flint River. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mainly rural areas of West Central Spalding County This includes the following streams and drainages... Wildcat Creek, Flint River and Heads Creek. Flooding is curring along the Heads Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC DAM FAILURE...IMMINENT
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. If you are in low lying areas below the Head`s Creek Reservoir you should move to higher ground immediately. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. A Red Cross Shelter is now open in City Park in Griffin.
